intro: Antirrhinum vexillocalyculatum var. typicum, commonly known as the velvetleaf snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of southern Europe. It is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and clusters of tubular, two-lipped flowers that bloom in shades of pink to purple. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields, and it flowers from late spring to early summer. Its unique floral structure and ornamental appearance make it a notable species in botanical gardens and wildflower collections.
